content.question:
For parts of the free response question that require calculations, clearly show the method used and the steps involved in arriving at your answers. You must show your work to receive credit for your answer. Examples and equations may be included in your answers where appropriate.

For parts of the free response question that require calculations, clearly show the method used and the steps involved in arriving at your answers. You must show your work to receive credit for your answer. Examples and equations may be included in your answers where appropriate.

A student is asked to prepare a buffer solution made with equimolar amounts of <math alttext="C H 3 N H 2, aqueous" display="inline" overflow="scroll"><msub><mn>CH</mn><mn>3</mn></msub><msub><mn>NH</mn><mn>2</mn></msub><mpadded><mo>(</mo><mpadded><mi>a</mi><mi>q</mi></mpadded><mo>)</mo></mpadded></math> and <math alttext="C H 3 N H 3 C l, solid" display="inline" overflow="scroll"><msub><mn>CH</mn><mn>3</mn></msub><msub><mn>NH</mn><mn>3</mn></msub><mn>Cl</mn><mpadded><mo>(</mo><mpadded><mi>s</mi></mpadded><mo>)</mo></mpadded></math>. The student uses <math alttext="25.00 milliliters" display="inline" overflow="scroll"><mn>25.00</mn><mspace width="0.25em"></mspace><mi>mL</mi></math> of <math alttext="0.100 molar C H 3 N H 2, aqueous" display="inline" overflow="scroll"><mn>0.100</mn><mspace width="0.25em"></mspace><mi>M</mi><mspace width="0.25em"></mspace><msub><mi>CH</mi><mn>3</mn></msub><msub><mi>NH</mi><mn>2</mn></msub><mo stretchy="false">(</mo><mi>a</mi><mi>q</mi><mo stretchy="false">)</mo></math>, which contains <math alttext="0.00250 mole" display="inline" overflow="scroll"><mn>0.00250</mn><mspace width="0.25em"></mspace><mi>mol</mi></math> of <math alttext="C H 3 N H 2" display="inline" overflow="scroll"><msub><mn>CH</mn><mn>3</mn></msub><msub><mn>NH</mn><mn>2</mn></msub></math>, to make the buffer.

(a) Calculate the mass of <math alttext="C H 3 N H 3 C l, solid" display="inline" overflow="scroll"><msub><mn>CH</mn><mn>3</mn></msub><msub><mn>NH</mn><mn>3</mn></msub><mn>Cl</mn><mpadded><mo>(</mo><mpadded><mi>s</mi></mpadded><mo>)</mo></mpadded></math> that contains <math alttext="0.00250 mole" display="inline" overflow="scroll"><mn>0.00250</mn><mspace width="0.25em"></mspace><mi>mol</mi></math> of <math alttext="C H 3 N H 3 C l" display="inline" overflow="scroll"><msub><mn>CH</mn><mn>3</mn></msub><msub><mn>NH</mn><mn>3</mn></msub><mn>Cl</mn></math>.

frqParts.text:
For parts of the free response question that require calculations, clearly show the method used and the steps involved in arriving at your answers. You must show your work to receive credit for your answer. Examples and equations may be included in your answers where appropriate.

For parts of the free response question that require calculations, clearly show the method used and the steps involved in arriving at your answers. You must show your work to receive credit for your answer. Examples and equations may be included in your answers where appropriate.

A student is asked to prepare a buffer solution made with equimolar amounts of <math alttext="C H 3 N H 2, aqueous" display="inline" overflow="scroll"><msub><mn>CH</mn><mn>3</mn></msub><msub><mn>NH</mn><mn>2</mn></msub><mpadded><mo>(</mo><mpadded><mi>a</mi><mi>q</mi></mpadded><mo>)</mo></mpadded></math> and <math alttext="C H 3 N H 3 C l, solid" display="inline" overflow="scroll"><msub><mn>CH</mn><mn>3</mn></msub><msub><mn>NH</mn><mn>3</mn></msub><mn>Cl</mn><mpadded><mo>(</mo><mpadded><mi>s</mi></mpadded><mo>)</mo></mpadded></math>. The student uses <math alttext="25.00 milliliters" display="inline" overflow="scroll"><mn>25.00</mn><mspace width="0.25em"></mspace><mi>mL</mi></math> of <math alttext="0.100 molar C H 3 N H 2, aqueous" display="inline" overflow="scroll"><mn>0.100</mn><mspace width="0.25em"></mspace><mi>M</mi><mspace width="0.25em"></mspace><msub><mi>CH</mi><mn>3</mn></msub><msub><mi>NH</mi><mn>2</mn></msub><mo stretchy="false">(</mo><mi>a</mi><mi>q</mi><mo stretchy="false">)</mo></math>, which contains <math alttext="0.00250 mole" display="inline" overflow="scroll"><mn>0.00250</mn><mspace width="0.25em"></mspace><mi>mol</mi></math> of <math alttext="C H 3 N H 2" display="inline" overflow="scroll"><msub><mn>CH</mn><mn>3</mn></msub><msub><mn>NH</mn><mn>2</mn></msub></math>, to make the buffer.

(a) Calculate the mass of <math alttext="C H 3 N H 3 C l, solid" display="inline" overflow="scroll"><msub><mn>CH</mn><mn>3</mn></msub><msub><mn>NH</mn><mn>3</mn></msub><mn>Cl</mn><mpadded><mo>(</mo><mpadded><mi>s</mi></mpadded><mo>)</mo></mpadded></math> that contains <math alttext="0.00250 mole" display="inline" overflow="scroll"><mn>0.00250</mn><mspace width="0.25em"></mspace><mi>mol</mi></math> of <math alttext="C H 3 N H 3 C l" display="inline" overflow="scroll"><msub><mn>CH</mn><mn>3</mn></msub><msub><mn>NH</mn><mn>3</mn></msub><mn>Cl</mn></math>.

The student has the following materials and equipment available.

• Distilled water
 • Electronic balance
 • <math alttext="50 milliliter " overflow="scroll"> <mn>50</mn> <mspace width="0.25em"> </mspace> <mi>mL</mi> </math> beaker
 • Pipets

• <math alttext="0.100 molar C H 3 N H 2, aqueous" overflow="scroll"> <mn>0.100</mn> <mspace width="0.25em"> </mspace> <mi>M</mi> <mspace width="0.25em"> </mspace> <msub> <mn>CH</mn> <mn>3</mn> </msub> <msub> <mn>NH</mn> <mn>2</mn> </msub> <mo stretchy="false">(</mo> <mi>a</mi> <mi>q</mi> <mo stretchy="false">)</mo> </math>
 • Weighing paper
 • <math alttext="10.0 milliliter" overflow="scroll"> <mn>10.0</mn> <mspace width="0.25em"> </mspace> <mi>mL</mi> </math> graduated cylinder
 • <math alttext="p H" overflow="scroll"><mi>pH</mi></math> meter

• Solid <math alttext="C H 3 N H 3 C l" overflow="scroll"> <msub> <mn>CH</mn> <mn>3</mn> </msub> <msub> <mn>NH</mn> <mn>3</mn> </msub> <mn>Cl</mn> </math>
 • <math alttext="50.00 milliliter" overflow="scroll"> <mn>50.00</mn> <mspace width="0.25em"> </mspace> <mi>mL</mi> </math> buret
 • Small spatula

(b) The following table contains a partial procedure for making the buffer solution. Fill in steps 1 and 4 to complete the procedure using only materials and equipment selected from the choices given. (Not all materials listed will be used. Assume that all appropriate safety measures are already in place.)

Step
 Procedure

1

2
 Place the solid in the <math alttext="50 milliliter" overflow="scroll"> <mn>50</mn> <mo> </mo> <mo> </mo> <mo> </mo> <mo> </mo> <mtext>mL</mtext> </math> beaker.

3
 Clean the buret and rinse with distilled water.

4

5
 Use the buret to add <math alttext="25.00 milliliters" overflow="scroll"> <mn>25.00</mn> <mo> </mo> <mo> </mo> <mo> </mo> <mo> </mo> <mtext>mL</mtext> </math> of <math alttext="0.100 molar C H 3 N H 2, aqueous" overflow="scroll"> <mn>0.100</mn> <mo> </mo> <mo> </mo> <mo> </mo> <mi>M</mi> <mo> </mo> <mo> </mo> <msub> <mtext>CH</mtext> <mn>3</mn> </msub> <msub> <mtext>NH</mtext> <mn>2</mn> </msub> <mtext>(</mtext> <mi>a</mi> <mi>q</mi> <mtext>)</mtext> </math> to the beaker.

6
 Mix well.

7
 Check the <math alttext="p H" overflow="scroll"><mtext>pH</mtext></math> with the <math alttext="p H" overflow="scroll"><mtext>pH</mtext></math> meter.

The value of <math alttext="k sub b" overflow="scroll"> <msub> <mi>K</mi> <mi>b</mi> </msub> </math> for <math alttext="C H 3 N H 2, aqueous" overflow="scroll"> <msub> <mn>CH</mn> <mn>3</mn> </msub> <msub> <mn>NH</mn> <mn>2</mn> </msub> <mo stretchy="false">(</mo> <mi>a</mi> <mi>q</mi> <mo stretchy="false">)</mo> </math> is <math alttext="4.4 times , 10 to the negative 4 power ." overflow="scroll"> <mn>4.4</mn> <mo>×</mo> <msup> <mn>10</mn> <mrow> <mo>-</mo> <mn>4</mn> </mrow> </msup> </math>, and the <math alttext="p H" overflow="scroll"> <mi>pH</mi> </math> of the buffer the student prepared is <math alttext="10.64" overflow="scroll"> <mn>10.64</mn> </math>.

(c) The student prepares a second buffer solution. The student uses <math alttext="25.00 milliliters" overflow="scroll"> <mn>25.00</mn> <mspace width="0.25em"> </mspace> <mi>mL</mi> </math> of <math alttext="0.050 molar C H 3 N H 2, aqueous" overflow="scroll"> <mn>0.050</mn> <mspace width="0.25em"> </mspace> <mi>M</mi> <mspace width="0.25em"> </mspace> <msub> <mn>CH</mn> <mn>3</mn> </msub> <msub> <mn>NH</mn> <mn>2</mn> </msub> <mo stretchy="false">(</mo> <mi>a</mi> <mi>q</mi> <mo stretchy="false">)</mo> </math> instead of <math alttext="25.00 milliliters" overflow="scroll"> <mn>25.00</mn> <mspace width="0.25em"> </mspace> <mi>mL</mi> </math> of <math alttext="0.100 molar C H 3 N H 2, aqueous" overflow="scroll"><mn>0.100</mn><mspace width="0.25em"></mspace><mi>M</mi><mspace width="0.25em"></mspace><msub><mn>CH</mn><mn>3</mn></msub><msub><mn>NH</mn><mn>2</mn></msub><mo stretchy="false">(</mo><mi>a</mi><mi>q</mi><mo stretchy="false">)</mo></math>, and half the mass of <math alttext="C H 3 N H 3 Cl, solid" overflow="scroll"> <msub> <mn>CH</mn> <mn>3</mn> </msub> <msub> <mn>NH</mn> <mn>3</mn> </msub> <mn>Cl</mn> <mo stretchy="false">(</mo> <mi>s</mi> <mo stretchy="false">)</mo> </math> that was used in the first buffer. Is the <math alttext="p H" overflow="scroll"><mi>pH</mi></math> of the second buffer greater than, less than, or equal to the <math alttext="p H" overflow="scroll"><mi>pH</mi></math> of the first buffer? Justify your answer.

skill.text: 2.C: Identify experimental procedures that are aligned to a scientific question (which may include a sketch of a lab setup).
